content: Release procedure  Create a branch dedicated to the current release. Check gradle.properties file:  Check the consistency of the version.   Check build.gradle.kts file:  Use only released dependencies. Upgrade Keyple dependencies to their latest released versions.   Update CHANGELOG.md file:  Verify the consistency of the Unreleased section. Move content of Unreleased section to a new “release” section. Update bottom links.   Build and test the component. Commit the modified files using if possible the commit message Release x.y.z. Push and create a pull request to merge the branch into main. Await the success of the build by the CI. Squash and merge the pull request. Await the success of the build by the CI. Create a release on GitHub:  Set tag x.y.z Set release name x.y.z Set the content by copying/pasting the content of the current release description in the CHANGELOG.md file without the bottom links.   Await the success of the build by the CI. Connect to Nexus Repository Manager of Calypsonet and go to “Staging Repositories” page:  Select the correct folder to Close & Release. It must contain the manifests, the JAR and all the others elements (sources, javadoc). Close the folder. Release the folder. The other unwanted folders could be dropped.   Check the availability of the release on the Maven Repository. This step may take from 10 minutes to 2 hours. Update this website:  Update version in params.yaml file. Update others elements if needed. Commit and push the modifications.
summary: Release procedure  Create a branch dedicated to the current release. Check gradle.properties file:  Check the consistency of the version.   Check build.gradle.kts file:  Use only released dependencies.
title: Maintenance Guides

content:
This section lists the APIs that can be used to develop C++ Calypso® certifiable frameworks.
  Reader API Public API which defines the elements shared between the reader layer and the card layer.
  Card API Internal API which defines the elements shared between the reader layer and the card layer.
  Calypso API Public high-level API which standardizes the way to interact with a Calypso® product (card, NFC smartphone applet/application, SAM, etc…).
summary:
This section lists the APIs that can be used to develop C++ Calypso® certifiable frameworks.
  Reader API Public API which defines the elements shared between the reader layer and the card layer.
title: APIs for C++ language

content:
The diagram below shows the dependencies between the client application, the certifiable framework components and the terminal APIs:
  Here are the most important things to remember:
 Each API has its own life cycle. The APIs contain only interfaces. The “Reader API” and the “Calypso API” are public and can be used by the developer of the client application. The “Card API” is internal and is intended for the developer of the certifiable framework components only.
summary: General presentation of the dependencies between the different Terminal APIs.
title: Java - APIs overview

content:
1.0.0  GitHub  Changelog   Overview The Calypsonet Terminal Reader C++ API defines the public elements shared between the reader layer and the card layer.
 The third version number (x.y.z) only concerns updates of the documentation because this component does not contain any implementation, but only file headers.
summary: Public API which defines the elements shared between the reader layer and the card layer.
title: Calypsonet Terminal Reader C++ API

content:
1.0.0  Download  GitHub  Changelog   Overview The Calypsonet Terminal Reader Java API defines the public elements shared between the reader layer and the card layer.
Documentation  API documentation  Download All deliverables are available directly from the Maven Central Repository or by using one of the project resource managers below:
Gradle Groovy  Gradle Kotlin  Maven   Copy implementation 'org.calypsonet.terminal:calypsonet-terminal-reader-java-api:1.0.+'  implementation("org.calypsonet.terminal:calypsonet-terminal-reader-java-api:1.0.+")  <dependency> <groupId>org.calypsonet.terminal</groupId> <artifactId>calypsonet-terminal-reader-java-api</artifactId> <version>[1.0.0,1.1.0)</version> </dependency>    The third version number (x.y.z) only concerns updates of the javadoc because this component does not contain any implementation, but only an API. Therefore, it is recommended to always perform a dynamic import as described above in order to have the most up-to-date documentation.
summary: Public API which defines the elements shared between the reader layer and the card layer.
title: Calypsonet Terminal Reader Java API

content:
1.0.0  GitHub  Changelog   Overview The Calypsonet Terminal Calypso C++ API is an extension of the Calypsonet Terminal Reader C++ API which provides a high-level API standardizing the way to interact with a Calypso® product (card, NFC smartphone applet/application, SAM, etc…).
 The third version number (x.y.z) only concerns updates of the documentation because this component does not contain any implementation, but only file headers.
summary: Public high-level API which standardizes the way to interact with a Calypso® product (card, NFC smartphone applet/application, SAM, etc...).
title: Calypsonet Terminal Calypso C++ API
